title: Which English songs are best to listen to while travelling? - Quora

response.answer_text: Travel with words, meet the world. Here’s the playlist to listen while travelling - 1. Fast car -It is about change and wanting to escape. Road trips tend to do that, don’t they?  “You got a fast carIs it fast enough so we can fly away?We gotta make a decisionLeave tonight or live and die this way So remember when we were driving driving in your carSpeed so fast I felt like I was drunkCity lights lay out before usAnd your arm felt nice wrapped 'round my shoulderAnd I had a feeling that I belongedI had a feeling I could be someone, be someone, be someone” 2. Life is a highway -  “Life is a highway, I wanna ride it all night long / If you’re going my way, I wanna drive it all night long.” That’s how the song begins. You gonna love the song, one of my favorite. 3. Paradise -  “When she was just a girlShe expected the worldBut it flew away from her reachAnd the bullets catch in her teethLife goes on, it gets so heavyThe wheel breaks the butterflyEvery tear a waterfallIn the night the stormy night she'll close her eyesIn the night the stormy night away she'd fly” 4. Home -  “Settle down, it'll all be clearDon't pay no mind to the demonsThey fill you with fearThe trouble—it might drag you downIf you get lost, you can always be found Just know you're not alone'Cause I'm gonna make this place your home” 5. Lucy in the sky with diamonds -  Picture yourself in a boat on a riverWith tangerine trees and marmalade skiesSomebody calls you, you answer quite slowlyA girl with kaleidoscope eyes 6. Hotel California -  "This could be Heaven or this could be Hell"Then she lit up a candle and she showed me the wayThere were voices down the corridor,I thought I heard them say... 7. Wanted dead or alive -  I walk these streetsA loaded six-string on my backI play for keeps 'cause I might not make it backI been everywhere, still, I'm standing tallI've seen a million facesAnd I've rocked them all 8. All summer long -  Now nothing seems as strange as when the leaves began to changeOr how we thought those days would never endSometimes I'll hear that song and I'll start to sing alongAnd think man I'd love to see that girl again 9. Boulevard of broken dreams -  “I walk a lonely roadThe only one that I have ever knownDon't know where it goesBut it's home to me and I walk alone” “My shadow's the only one that walks beside meMy shallow heart's the only thing that's beatingSometimes I wish someone out there will find me'Til then I walk alone.” 10. The Nights -  “He said, "One day you'll leave this world behindSo live a life you will remember."My father told me when I was just a childThese are the nights that never die” “When thunder clouds start pouring downLight a fire they can't put outCarve your name into those shining starsHe said, "Go venture far beyond these shores.Don't forsake this life of yours.I'll guide you home no matter where you are." If you like my music recommendations, follow me on my blog “Music Devotee”.

Cat Stevens- Father and Son David Bowie- Move On, and Space Oddity Queen- Bohemian Rhapsody (the best sing-along song out there) John Denver- Leaving on a Jetplane Fleet Foxes- Mykonos The Beatles- Day Tripper, Octopuses Garden, Yellow Submarine, Rocky Racoon Bob Marley- No Woman No Cry, Three Little Birds Bruce Springsteen- I’m On Fire Keb Mo- Am I Wrong Klak Tik- Reborn KT Tunstall- Suddenly I See Led Zeppelin- When the Levee Breaks Bon Jovi- Livin’ on a Prayer Marilyn Manson- While My Guitar Gently Weeps (cover) Metallica- Turn the Page Moody Blues- Nights in White Satin Pink Floyd- Hey You, Shine On You Crazy Diamond, High Hopes Paolo Nutini- New Shoes, Pencil Full of Lead Poets of the Fall- Carnival of Rust (must.song.along) Tenacious D- Tribute Tracy Chapman- Fast Car Nina Simone- Sinnerman Joan Osborne- Spooky (originally by Dusty Springfield, but I prefer this one) Johnny Cash- Ring of Fire Journey- Don’t Stop Believing Tex Williams- Smoke Smoke Smoke Wolfmother- New Moon Rising, Joker and the Thief

The best English song to listen while travelling is Comfortable Numb by Linkin Park.  Comfortable Numb lyrics “Comfortably Numb Lyrics” is a song by the English rock band Pink Floyd, released on their eleventh album, The Wall (1979). It was released as a single in 1980 with “Hey You” as the B-side. The chorus progression and guitar solos were written by guitarist David Gilmour, while the lyrics and verse progression were written by bassist Roger Waters. Singer: Linkin Floyd Singer: David Galmour, Roger Waters Song Writer: David Galmour, Roger Waters Comfortable Numb lyrics, Numb With Lyrics Hello? Hello? Hello?Is there anybody in there?Just nod if you can hear meIs there anyone at home?Come on nowI hear you’re feeling downWell I can ease your painGet you on your feet againRelaxI’ll need some information firstJust the basic factsCan you show me where it hurts?There is no pain you are recedingA distant ship smoke on the horizonYou are only coming through in wavesYour lips move but I can’t hear what you’re sayingWhen I was a child I had a feverMy hands felt just like two balloonsNow I’ve got that feeling once againI can’t explain you would not understandThis is not how I amI have become comfortably numbOkayJust a little pinprickThere’ll be no more, ahBut you may feel a little sickCan you stand up?I do believe it’s working, goodThat’ll keep you going through the showCome on it’s time to goThere is no pain you are recedingA distant ship, smoke on the horizonYou are only coming through in wavesYour lips move but I can’t hear what you’re sayingWhen I was a childI caught a fleeting glimpseOut of the corner of my eyeI turned to look but it was goneI cannot put my finger on it nowThe child is grownThe dream is goneI have become comfortably numb

Journeys are incomplete without good music. Here's a list of songs that I enjoy listening to while travelling: Fast Cars by Tracy Chapman Careless Whisper by George Michael I Will Always Love You by Whitney Houston Nothing’s Gonna Change My Love for You by George Benson When a Man Loves a Woman by Michael Bolten Aicha and Calling You by Outlandish Boulevard of Broken Dreams by Greenday Who Cares by John Mayer Hello by Adele as well as by Lionel Richie Take Me to Church and Someone New by Hozier Let Her Go by Passenger Shooting Stars Take your Time by Sam Hunt

Well in case you want to try some old songs, you can pick up any of the albums of the Beatles. Most of their songs are comforting and relaxing, especially I saw her standing there. In case of some other quick references, you could try In case you feel angry or tired and need a boost of spirit NumbIn the endBoulevard of broken dreamsI'm coming homeA few great festive spirit songs Euro 16 themeCheap thrillsLean On(with the video)Nothing else matters by metallicaSome more songs that might catch your attention are SorryCloserHomecoming by green dayYou and IAddicted

“The moon song” from “Her” I don't know it's singer but the songs music and the lyrics is really soothing. The first time I listened to this song was on a December morning at like 6 o’ clock , I was in Nargol (Gujrat). As I recall it was the last day of a meditation camp, the realization that it's time say good bye to a loved one & time to go back home struck me. As I listen to this song it takes me back to that time, the chilled winds and waves of sea, the silence & the noice of the trees, everything. I don't know if it's about the lyrics or the music of this song but whenever I listen to this song while travelling it reminds me to let go, to be in each passing moment, a witness, a watcher. This is the photo I clicked that morning. I could attach a video but there's no option.

In English, or by English bands? For travelling, I prefer songs I can fall asleep to. I also prefer whole albums, so that I know what’s coming and there are no surprises while I’m trying to sleep. Two good ones sung in English are Cat Power, “The Greatest” and Bonobo, “Days to Come,” but it’s up to you and your own personal tastes to find what works for you. I also like the French band Volo for good travelling/sleeping music, mais d’accord, they sing in French.

Depends on how you're traveling If you're in a car on a long drive or on a long journey then a collection of classical English bands and Highway Blues will certainly not fail to please you If you're in a bus or a metro then Bass and electronic Music would be better
Rock songs like Green day’s Boulevard Of Broken Dreams. EDM like Red Lights by Tiesto Songs of which you know the whole lyrics and can sing along with the singer.
